org.jsmsengine
Class CATHandler

java.lang.Object
  org.jsmsengine.CATHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
CATHandler_Nokia, CATHandler_Siemens, CATHandler_SonyEricsson, CATHandler_Wavecom
public class CATHandler
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains all the AT commands which are used during communication of the API with the GSM device.

This is the generic handler. It should be compatible with all devices. However, "should" is a big word... Some GSM modems may need slightly different AT commands to work. In this case, subclassing of CATHandler() is required.

Note for those creating subclassed versions of CATHandler for their own modems:
All methods that are marked as "***Critical method***" should be implemented, otherwise the jSMSEngine API will not work. The Non-Critical may be left unimplemented - they should not affect the normal jSMSEngine API operation.

sync

public void sync()
          throws java.lang.Exception
Sends a couple of "AT" commands in order to sync with modem.
Useful with auto-baud-detecting GSM devices.
***Critical method***

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

reset

public void reset()
           throws java.lang.Exception
This command should soft-reset the modem.
Soft-reset is not available for all GSM devices, and the operation is not critical.
***Non-Critical method***

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

public boolean keepGsmLinkOpen()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Keeps the GSM link open for sending multiple messages in less time.
Not critical. If this option is supported, message dispatch may be a little faster.

True if operated succeded.

In case of errors, it rerties up to three times to complete the operation before it returns failure.
